byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and PETER BAKER

abstract: Republican Sen Bob Corker, new Foreign Relations Committee chairman, emerges as pivotal figure in discussions about any United States nuclear agreement with Iran; Obama administration knows it must broker compromise with Corker over legislation that will require congressional approval for agreement with Iran, or it will have to convince enough Democrats to vote no on legislation to deny Corker veto-proof majority.
lead_paragraph: Few people on Capitol Hill are more important to the White House now than Senator Bob Corker, the Republican behind a bill to force President Obama to send any deal with Iran to Congress for approval.

headline.main: G.O.P. Senator, Bob Corker, Is Key Player in Iran Accord
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Senator Is Major Player In Iran Accord

snippet: Few people on Capitol Hill are more important to the White House now than Senator Bob Corker, the Republican behind a bill to force President Obama to send any deal with Iran to Congress for approval.
